intro: Frasera tetrapetala f. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered frasera, is a rare and striking plant native to the western United States. It is a flowering plant in the family Gentianaceae, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins and thrives in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments. It is often found in montane forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in some regions.
